required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study inTreatment of Trigeminal Neuralgia
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study Between Microvascular Decompression and Percutaneous Radiofrequency Rhizotomy for Treatment of Trigeminal Neuralgia

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the results of percutaneous radiofrequency rhizotomy and the effectiveness of microvascular decompression for the treatment of trigeminal neuralgia and Comparing between them according the different outcome parameters.

detailed_description.textblock: This is prospective case -series hospital based study, will be conducted on 40 patients with trigeminal neuralgia treated either by percutaneous radiofrequency trigeminal rhizotomy or microvascular decompression at Sohag University Hospitals, between march 2021 and June 2022 and we will divide the the patients into two groups ,one group will be treated with percutaneous radiofrequency trigeminal rhizotomy and the other group will be treated with microvascular decompression and we will asses the results with the Barrow Neurological Institute Pain Intensity Score .

primary_outcome.measure: Barrow Neurological Institute Pain Intensity Score
primary_outcome.description: I (no pain, no medication), II (occasional pain, not requiring medication), III (some pain, controlled with medication), IV (some pain, not controlled with medication) V (severe pain, no pain relief with medication).

arm_group.description: it is the group that will be treated with Percutaneous Radiofrequency Rhizotomy
it is the group that will be treated with Microvascular decompression

intervention.description: percutaneous radiofrequency trigeminal rhizotomy is a perctaneous procedure that ablate the sensory part of the nerve and

intervention.intervention_name: Microvascular decompression of the trigeminal nerve
intervention.description: Microvascular decompression is a procedure that decompress the nerve from vascular conflict
